channel.title: Need help to install java to school PC WITHOUT adminstrator premission!
channel.description: Help? :D I need to play and macro here :P

item.title: Need help to install java to school PC WITHOUT adminstrator premission!
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:9, topic:13867”][quote author=l3etal3lade link=topic=20748.msg237253#msg237253 date=1158089163]
http://commerce.bea.com/products/weblogicjrockit/accept_terms50.jsp

I was having the same problem at my school I am trying to download that its prolly a little different but its worth a try I am Installing it as we type it works so far while suns didn’t even start the installer you may need to designate a new path other then program files I just chose my desktop in a new folder called Java, Like I said its working so far.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 11, 2006, 02:05:48 PM[/size][hr]Did my post help anyone? At all?
[/quote]
msn now pl0x[/quote]

Yeah get on msn l3eta you fakking nab =P

Read full topic

Tarantula:

Is it possible that, i just copy my installed java to my memory stick, and paste to school pc? Is it possible that java works this way?

No, you need it installed.

item.title: Need help to install java to school PC WITHOUT adminstrator premission!
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

Actually, in my school you can. All year two students are in the group called “power users”. That group allows us to install, download and do just about anything on any computer connected to the school network, as long as we don’t touch the windows system configurations.

And Pie, stop that useless quoting. Read the rules; “If we don’t have anything to say, we don’t say anything at all”. You have been warned.

Read full topic
